snippet: Donald J. Trump’s personal letters, alternately admiring and acidic, offer an archive of his emotional states and have become mementos for hundreds of recipients.
abstract: Hundreds of people across country have in their possession letters sent to them by Donald Trump, one of his preferred forms of communication; review of archive of Trump's letters from 1970s until today underscores his hyperbolic style and reveal both his insecurities and perceptiveness.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Ashley Parker, Kitty Bennett, Steve Eder and Jeremy B. Merrill.

lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump’s personal letters, alternately admiring and acidic, offer an archive of his emotional states and have become mementos for hundreds of recipients.

headline.main: Donald Trump’s Secret Weapon: Letters of Love, Flattery and Revenge
headline.print_headline: Twitter and TV Master Has a Secret Weapon: Letters of Love, Flattery and Revenge
